title: Tourists causing chaos , clock ticking on TikTok , bitter Arctic blast : Catch up on the day stories
body_text:
Tourists causing chaos, clock ticking on TikTok, bitter Arctic blast: Catch up on the dayâ€™s stories
By Daniel Wine, CNN
Editorâ€™s Note: CNNâ€™s 5 Things newsletter is your one-stop shop for the latest headlines and fascinating stories to start and end your busy day. Sign up here.
ğŸ‘‹ Welcome to 5 Things PM! More than 30 years after scientists discovered links to cancer in animals, the US Food and Drug Administration banned the use of red dye No. 3 in food, beverages and ingested drugs. The synthetic color additive made from petroleum gives them a bright cherry-red color.
Hereâ€™s what else you might have missed during your busy day:
5 things
1ï¸âƒ£ Too many tourists: Higher visitor fees. Bans on cruise ships. Crackdowns on vacation rentals. Some frustrated residents in Barcelona even sprayed tourists with water pistols. These are some of the ways popular destinations dealt with massive crowds last year â€” and this summer looks like it will be just as chaotic.
2ï¸âƒ£ Sleep woes: A restless night may leave you feeling tired at work, but what if your job is the very thing disrupting your rest? People with highly sedentary jobs â€” thatâ€™s about 80% of the US workforce â€” face a significantly higher risk of insomnia, according to a new study.
3ï¸âƒ£ Arctic blast: Mother Nature is about to unleash dangerously low temperatures that will be the coldest to hit the US in a year. Temperatures could be almost 30 degrees below normal starting this weekend for millions of people across the Lower 48 states.
4ï¸âƒ£ Tick-tock: As the clock winds down on TikTok, itâ€™s getting to be decision-making time. The popular video appâ€™s owner, ByteDance, either has to sell, shut it down or try to keep the lights on long enough for President-elect Donald Trump to potentially come to the rescue.
5ï¸âƒ£ Bad ad: Pakistan International Airways is catching a lot of flak over a promotional graphic that appears to evoke a terror attack on Paris. The image shows a passenger jet flying toward the Eiffel Tower. Take a look.
Watch this
ğŸ’ A glimmer of hope: Firefighter Chien Yu lost his home, as well as the school his children attended, in the Los Angeles wildfires. When he returned to see the destruction, Yu found his wedding ring amid the rubble.
